name: Steven Xie
blurb: I study CS at the University of Waterloo, and I aim to build things that matter.

experiences.title: Full-stack Developer @ ConsenSys
points: Developed a team management webapp using [[React](lib)], [[MongoDB](tech)], and [[Neo4J](tech)], which aims to support the operation of decentralized organizations like ConsenSys.
Solved problems related to relationship-focused data using [[graph databases](tech)], and architecting scalable data-heavy applications using [[Redux](lib)] and [[websockets](tech)].
Gained experience working in a fast-paced startup environment, and learned about the importance of constant feedback when working in a team.

experiences.title: iOS App Developer @ Evichat
points: Designed and programmed Evichat's primary iOS client app in [[Swift 3](lang)], which acted as the client entrypoint for Evichat's services.
Implemented [[OAuth 1.0 and 2.0](tech)] auth flows to integrate with social services like Gmail, Twitter, and Instagram.
Improved code maintainability by modularizing the app into separate networking and UI components using [[CoacoaPods](tech)].

experiences.title: Software Developer @ buildABILITY
points: Created a cross-platform certificate creator and sender using [[Electron](lib)] and [[Node.js](tech)] to automate a PDF-creation and emailing procedure.
Transformed a 90-minute manual procedure into a 30-second automated one (per batch of 100 clients), dramatically increasing operational efficiency.
Integrated with external APIs to read and write to CSVs, produce and rasterize PDFs, and send emails.

projects.name: express-starter
points: Developed a starter kit for [[Express](lib)], [[Typescript](lang)], and [[Docker](tech)] to bootstrap webapp development for myself and for friends wanting to start with web development, but who were struggling with the setup.
Documented the starter kit with beginner-friendly explanations on how Express routes are configured, and about the Docker container build process.

projects.name: Elevate (Team Project)
points: Creating a game-based learning system in [[Unity](tech)] to help people with autism spectrum disorder learn everyday life skills.
Developing a dashboard / analysis system in [[React](lib)] and [[Python](lang)] [[(Flask)](lib)] to allow parents and teachers to track player progress and discover insights.

education.name: University of Waterloo
education.blurb: Candidate for Bachelors of Computer Science (BCS).

awards.title: Hack4Health Third Place Winner
points: Worked with a team to design and pitch Pilot, a cross-platform todo-based personal assistant with a simple interface, designed specifically to help people with dementia.
Designed a dementia-friendly interface on [[Sketch]], and prototyped with [[React Native]] and [[Expo]].
